feed.title: Buy or Beware: Hairspray
feed.subtitle: We try before you buy! Dose.ca editors are playing guinea pigs to get the 411 on the latest beauty products. This week we've put five of our favourite hairspray brands to the test. Find out which one outlasted and outshined the competition.

content.div:
We try before you buy! Dose.ca editors are playing guinea pigs to get the 411 on the latest beauty products. This week we've put five of our favourite hairspray brands to the test. Find out which one outlasted and outshined the competition.



L'Oreal Elnett Satin (suggested retail price: $14.99)

“This has been my go-to hairspray ever since it became available in North America a couple of years ago (before then, it was only sold in Europe). It’s clear why hardcore fashionistas and stylists have been smuggling this stuff across the pond for decades – it’s great! The mist is really fine, and it manages to hold your style without ever looking or feeling crusty. The best part about it is how easily it brushes out. Whether you screw up mid-style (something I do often), or you just want to remove it at the end of the night, running a brush lightly through your hair leaves it soft, full of volume and virtually product-free. Rating: 4.5/5” –Jen McDonnell, managing editor, Dose.ca

"Some touch-ups may have been in order -- my curling-iron ringlets began to unfurl within a few hours -- but you can't beat Elnett's texture: shiny, soft and a dream to brush out. My only real complaint is the scent. Please, hairspray fairies, find a way to make this stuff smell like candy or flowers or promises -- instead of whatever nasty chemicals I use to freeze my hair in place. Rating: 4/5" - Leah Collins, music editor, Dose.ca

"L'Oreal Elnett is one of my favourites; it's no wonder that it is used worldwide on runways. It lives up to its claim: it's affordable and lasts throughout the work day -- or a long night out. For a drugstore brand, this is a must-have for anyone's beauty drawer. Rating: 4.5/5" -MF


OSiS Freeze Finish Strong Hold Hairspray (suggested retail price: $19)

“I was really looking forward to reviewing this one, since I use another product in this line – the OSiS Glamour Queen spray, which is great for setting my curls in hot rollers. The thing I love about the Glamour Queen is its cool nozzle, which gives you a super targeted spray. The Freeze Finish didn’t have it, so it lost some points there. But, like the Glamour Queen, it smelled great and boasted a decent hold. Rating: 3/5” – JM

"Shine? Check. Strong hold? Check. Crispy? Not exactly -- but it did leave my hair "firmer" than the other two products I tested, and was the most tangle-inducing of the bunch. To clarify, though, that's not really a mark against it. If I'd tried this one on its own, its shine and flexibility would've been much more impressive. Rating: 3.5/5" -LC

"The OSiS hairspray was great. The fine mist made it easy to apply and virtually dummy-proof when it came to getting the desired amount of coverage. During the day I had great hold, minimal crunch and it smelled great! The only downside is it's only available in salons. It was my second favourite, after the Moroccanoil. Rating: 4/5" -MF


LaCoupe Flexible Gix Finishing Spray (suggested retail price: $7.99)

“This was my least favourite of all the sprays we tested. It was sticky and left my hair with that dreaded crunchy feel. The worst part was that I could see white flakes where I sprayed it. I have enough issues with grey hair – I don’t need any help from my hairspray! Also, it smelled like pumpkins, so I spent the whole day craving pumpkin pie. That’s just mean. Rating: 1/5” – JM

"I have nothing good to say about this hairspray; it left my hair crunchy, stiff and unmanageable. If that wasn’t already enough to cause a bad hair day, I also had to suffer through unbearable scent that wafted every time I moved my head. This one is headed straight to the garbage bin. Rating: 1/5" –MF

"The LaCoupe flexible fix finishing spray was good, but not exceptional. The hairspray held my style for majority of the day (but not the entire day like Joico). The smell was fair and I was still able to toss my hair around and have it move, so I appreciated that it gave me a reasonable hold with some flexibility. Rating 3.5/5" –Malaika Reynolds, intern, National Post


JOICO JOISHAPE Shaping & Finishing Spray (suggested retail price: $19.95)

“This was a decent hairspray – it offered a nice, light mist that wasn’t too sticky. The hold wasn’t as strong as the others, but it managed to keep my style mostly intact for the entire day. Also, it smelled like pineapple. What’s with these produce-smelling hairsprays? Rating: 3/5” –JM

"The Joico had great hold, smelled great and lasted all day -- and on its own it would have gotten a great rating from me if I wasn’t comparing it to my prior love (Elnett) or my new love (Moroccanoil). Rating: 3/5" –MF

"This product is undoubtedly my favourite. The spray had a heavier feeling on my hair, but it stayed in place for a very long time. I was able to move my hair, and although the smell wasn’t the best, it got the job done. It lasted nearly the entire day, neatly keeping my hair in place. Rating 5/5" -MR


Moroccanoil Luminous Strong Flexible Hold Hairspray (suggested retail price: $23.80)

“I didn’t think any hairspray could beat my beloved Elnett, but this one managed to. It boasted an incredibly fine, weightless mist and smelled like baby powder. It was soft to the touch but still strong enough to hold my style. Much like Elnett, this one also brushed out completely and left my hair soft and manageable. I hate that my favourite product is also the most expensive one of the bunch, but I’m not surprised. Rating: 5/5” –JM

"If it weren't for the price tag, this would be the hairspray for me. Not only did it hold my blown-out style throughout the work day, but it did so sans-crunch. My hair was shiny, kitten-soft -- plus slightly perfumed, without that lingering glue-huffer scent associated with some other sprays. It's not a miracle-potion delivered via aerosol or anything, but it's definitely of quality. Rating: 4.5/5" -LC

"This is by far the best hairspray I have ever used. So much so, it beat out my usual fave, Elnett. It goes on light, sprays evenly, lasts all day -- and smells so good that I questioned eating it. With those qualities, I can honestly say that it is worth the extra cost to splurge on this super spray. Rating: 5/5" -MF

"The Moroccanoil spray had a very light quality; it did not weigh down my hair. This line is well known for its moisturizing properties, and I will admit did make my hair feel soft. The smell was wonderful but the product was very weak when it came to staying power. It simply did not last for a very long time. After a few hours, my ‘do fizzled. The label said the product offers a flexible hold, but the problem is that the hold is too flexible. The texture it gave my hair was great; I just wish that it lasted longer. Rating 2.5/5" –MR
